jparsec.graph

Class TextLabel

  • java.lang.Object
    • jparsec.graph.TextLabel

  • public class TextLabel
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is designed to bundle together all the information required to draw short Strings with subscripts and superscripts.

    The string should be encoded following some rules:

    - Superscripts and subscript using ^ and _ characters, followed by the text to be drawn in superscript or subscript.

    - You can use ^{superscript} to delimited the portion to be superscripted or subscripted.

    - You can use '@COMMAND' to use a special command. Available commands are Greek letters ('@alpha' for small and '@ALPHA', '@BETA' for capital, see a list of available Greek letter in Constellation class), colors ('@RED', '@BLUE', and so on, using any color directly provided as constant in Java's Color class), size change ('@SIZExx', where xx is the size of the text), and @ FOLLOWED BY BOLD, ITALIC, or PLAIN.

    - You can draw latex formulas with the command '@LATEX{}', with the latex formula between the {}.

    - You can draw digital clock symbols with the command '@CLOCK{}', with the numbers between the {}. Besides numbers, supported characters are hmsº'": _-dDbBtTCUL. The plus + is mapped to a blank space of half width. In case of bold effect applied, the digits will be drawn with a blur effect.

    - You can rotate text with the '@ROTATExxx' command, being xxx the angle in degrees.

    - You can increase/decrease text size with '@SIZE+x' and '@SIZE-x'.

    - You can use transparent color to hide something with '@TRANSPARENT'.

    - You can justify text to the right, center, or left of the input position using '@RIGHT', '@CENTER', and '@LEFT'.

    - You can insert a blank space inside a subscript/superscript with '@SPACE', in those cases where programatically the text is split or cut whenever a blank space like ' ' is found.

    - It is recommended to clear the list of text states whenever a new text if written with clearTextStateList().

    Example:

    ln(@REDy{^@ORANGEx_i}@SIZE20@GREENHI@BLUE@ALPHA@BETA@GAMMA@SIZE10@BLACK) = ln (y^xi HI alfa beta gamma ), where the Greek characters will be drawn in Greek, HI in a bigger size, and some portions in different colors.

    Other special symbols include the sun, the planets, and the constellations. However, all these symbols will be drawn only if they are available in the system.

    Version:
    $Revision: 2.00 $, $Date: 2007/10/28$, $Revision: 1.10 $, $Date: 1996/09/05 04:53:27 $
    Author:
    T. Alonso Albi - OAN (Spain), Leigh Brookshaw

    • Field Detail

      • TRY_TO_EXPORT_GREEK_CHARACTERS_TO_PDF

        public static boolean TRY_TO_EXPORT_GREEK_CHARACTERS_TO_PDF
        This flag determines if an attempt will be made to export Greek fonts to a Graphics context belonging to a PDFGraphics2D instance or similar. What this does is to render Greek fonts using the font Font.SERIF from Java and 'a' for the Greek alpha, 'b' for beta, and so on. In an external app calling this you will need to map the Font.SERIF font to font 'Symbol', in case this font is available in your system, as usually happens. This is a hack that works fine for the iText library, but requires an adequate FontMapper object. Default value is false, that allows to export Greek characters to images and render them in the PDF (but not in vector graphics).

      • setRenderUnicodeAsImages

        public static void setRenderUnicodeAsImages(boolean renderUnicode)
        Set to true to render Unicode characters (Greek characters for example) as images. Default is false, but true maybe be useful to export to a Graphics context that doesn't support Unicode easily, like PDF output.
        Parameters:
        renderUnicode - True or false.

      • clearTextStateList

        public static void clearTextStateList()
        Clears the list of text states.

      • parseText

        public void parseText(java.awt.Graphics g,
             boolean justWidth)
        Parse the text. When the text is parsed the width, height, leading are all calculated. The text will only be truly parsed if the graphics context has changed or the text has changed or the font has changed. Otherwise nothing is done when this method is called.
        Parameters:
        g - Graphics context.
        justWidth - True if only the width of the string is requested (faster), false to draw everything.

      • isNull

        public boolean isNull()
        Returns if the text is null.
        Returns:
        true if the text has never been set or is null.
